segment.source: New features in Windows 10, version 1511
segment.target: New features in Windows 10, version 1511

segment.source: XTS-AES encryption algorithm.
segment.target: XTS-AES encryption algorithm.

segment.source: BitLocker now supports the XTS-AES encryption algorithm.
segment.target: BitLocker now supports the XTS-AES encryption algorithm.

segment.source: XTS-AES provides additional protection from a class of attacks on encryption that rely on manipulating cipher text to cause predictable changes in plain text.
segment.target: XTS-AES provides additional protection from a class of attacks on encryption that rely on manipulating cipher text to cause predictable changes in plain text.

segment.source: BitLocker supports both 128-bit and 256-bit XTS-AES keys.
segment.target: BitLocker supports both 128-bit and 256-bit XTS-AES keys.

segment.source: It provides the following benefits:
segment.target: It provides the following benefits:

segment.source: The algorithm is FIPS-compliant.
segment.target: The algorithm is FIPS-compliant.

segment.source: Easy to administer.
segment.target: Easy to administer.

segment.source: You can use the BitLocker Wizard, manage-bde, Group Policy, MDM policy, Windows PowerShell, or WMI to manage it on devices in your organization.
segment.target: You can use the BitLocker Wizard, manage-bde, Group Policy, MDM policy, Windows PowerShell, or WMI to manage it on devices in your organization.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Drives encrypted with XTS-AES will not be accessible on older version of Windows.
segment.target: Drives encrypted with XTS-AES will not be accessible on older version of Windows.

segment.source: This is only recommended for fixed and operating system drives.
segment.target: This is only recommended for fixed and operating system drives.

segment.source: Removable drives should continue to use the AES-CBC 128-bit or AES-CBC 256-bit algorithms.
segment.target: Removable drives should continue to use the AES-CBC 128-bit or AES-CBC 256-bit algorithms.

segment.source: New features in Windows 10
segment.target: New features in Windows 10

segment.source: Encrypt and recover your device with Azure Active Directory.
segment.target: Encrypt and recover your device with Azure Active Directory.

segment.source: In addition to using a Microsoft Account, automatic Device Encryption can now encrypt your devices that are joined to an Azure Active Directory domain.
segment.target: In addition to using a Microsoft Account, automatic Device Encryption can now encrypt your devices that are joined to an Azure Active Directory domain.

segment.source: When the device is encrypted, the BitLocker recovery key is automatically escrowed to Azure Active Directory.
segment.target: When the device is encrypted, the BitLocker recovery key is automatically escrowed to Azure Active Directory.

segment.source: This will make it easier to recover your BitLocker key online.
segment.target: This will make it easier to recover your BitLocker key online.

segment.source: DMA port protection.
segment.target: DMA port protection.

segment.source: You can use the DataProtection/AllowDirectMemoryAccess MDM policy to block DMA ports when the device is starting up.
segment.target: You can use the DataProtection/AllowDirectMemoryAccess MDM policy to block DMA ports when the device is starting up.

segment.source: Also, when a device is locked, all unused DMA ports are turned off, but any devices that are already plugged into a DMA port will continue to work.
segment.target: Also, when a device is locked, all unused DMA ports are turned off, but any devices that are already plugged into a DMA port will continue to work.

segment.source: When the device is unlocked, all DMA ports are turned back on.
segment.target: When the device is unlocked, all DMA ports are turned back on.

segment.source: New Group Policy for configuring pre-boot recovery.
segment.target: New Group Policy for configuring pre-boot recovery.

segment.source: You can now configure the pre-boot recovery message and recover URL that is shown on the pre-boot recovery screen.
segment.target: You can now configure the pre-boot recovery message and recover URL that is shown on the pre-boot recovery screen.

segment.source: For more info, see the "Configure pre-boot recovery message and URL" section in BitLocker Group Policy settings.
segment.target: For more info, see the "Configure pre-boot recovery message and URL" section in BitLocker Group Policy settings.
